description: Pasilla is so good!! Don't know why anyone would rate it poorly. The service is so nice and I eat here like once every week!
author: Davis G.

description:
Randomly came here for the first time on a cash only day. 

But, besides that. All positive.

Quick service. MONSTER-size salad. And for vegetarian salad, guac wasn't extra! What? This never happens. All my favorite items in this veggie Mex salad (jicama, actually good guac, salsa, onions, corn, beans, tortilla chips, red peppers, cheese (no thanks)). Surprisingly great customization options for bowls, salads, and tacos. Very Veg friendly! 

PLUS -- great salsa bar! I'm obsessed. Epitome of a perfect Mex salad. New fave. Please start to take card..we are in SF. 

Barely any places to sit and eat. This is a hole on the corner of the street.  Grab and GO dive into your huge meal!
author: Libby J.

description:
Pasilla is an oasis in the mass of overpriced and mediocre fast service restaurants in the Financial District.  The food is tasty and fresh and it doesn't cost $15 to get a basic burrito.

My go-to is a steak bowl with quinoa.  It's very nutritious and when paired with Pasilla's salsa, especially their spicy red, is one of my favorite meals to have in a pinch.
author: Mark C.

description:
Wow, inconsistent to the max. First burrito we had here was excellent, but just visited today and gave them not one but TWO attempts at a steak burrito and they blew it. First one had next to no meat in it (see pics), I brought to counter and she acknowledged the problem and had them remake it. 

Second attempt was barely any better. Basically their "steak" burrito is essentially a bean and rice burrito with a little steak salsa. I was curious so I tore apart the second one and separated out the beef- it was about a salsa cup's worth of meat. And, it was seasoned terribly, tasted and felt close to shoe leather. Maybe 2pm customers get the leftovers from noon. 

Was really gung-ho on this place after our first visit, thankfully waited until a second visit to judge. If a $10 "steak" burrito only contains a quarter's worth of badly seasoned meat, might as well get an honest vegetarian burrito. Salsas here weren't very good either, though I liked the corn chips. 

Second time is the last time here.
author: T J.

description: This place is ok in the food factor but I've been here like 4 tones and 3/4 times I've gotten my order wrong because the guy cashier who knows good English is evasive and the two chef lady's barely know how to speak English and use the register ... chips and salsa is close to 4$ for some reason I rather go somewhere else
author: DeL G.

description:
My friend in town was craving Mexican food so I Yelped and found this place. I stopped by at around 2:10pm on a Friday to order food to-go. The place was empty and was helped immediately. 

I ordered 2 Chicken Quesadillas ($8.25/ea), one with Make It Fajita (seasoned & sautéed green and red bell peppers and onions) option for $1.50 more and both without sour cream. 

The order was made quickly and I was out of the door within 15 minutes. 

We both thought the food was good but nothing stood out. One of the orders had sour cream leaking out of the box, even though I said no to sour cream. 

I think the price and the food quality correlates with each other. Also the value is pretty decent for a location near the Fidi.
author: Alice L.

description:
Pretty decent place. I didn't bother with the burrito because I have only found a handful of places in the city with good burritos. Instead, I went with the grilled steak quesadilla; can't go wrong with a cheese filled tortilla with meat!

The meat was tasty and it packed plenty of cheese. Initially, the first cut of the quesadilla was crispy (quesadilla was cut into 4 pieces). However being in a bowl, the other parts of the quesadilla became very soggy. I also tried their salsa bar which was pretty good as well. I mixed the salsa verde with their spicy salsa and it was great. 

Overall, good lunch pick! Will come back again.
author: Robbie P.

description: I went here yesterday for lunch. I thought it would be good but I was sadly mistaken. I ordered 3 grilled chicken tacos and the tortillas were not warmed the cheese barely melted and the chicken was dry. Then it was a piece of hair on my jalapeños so I just threw it away after that. Moral of the story is I won't be visiting this place of business again. I like my tacos to have some flavor and no hair in it.
author: Anais D.

description:
I come here often for a burrito when I've failed to bring lunch to work. I get the chicken breast burrito. Unfortunately that's all I can really vouch for as I haven't tried anything else. It's delicious, with a good beans to chicken to rice to nightshades ratio. 

They have a salsa bar at which you can serve yourself. Salsa bars automatically endear me to Mexican restaurant. Allowing me to abuse unlimited salsa privileges is the way to my heart. 

The place always seems very clean, and the staff are all very friendly and efficient.

There is almost no seating in the tiny building however most people are just hear to grab a food items and bring it back to their office I assume.
author: Colby W.

description:
Pasilla is a small Mexican food spot on kearny street, SF. A fellow co-worker introduced me to this place and I instantly fell in love with the menu. (Thanks to her )  They have great selection of healthy salads, bowls, tacos and burritos. 

I would suggest everyone to come a little early as this place gets really crowded during the lunch hours. So far, I have tried two things from there menu grilled chicken burrito and grilled chicken pasilla bowl w/o cheese and sour cream. 

Grilled Chicken Burrito - It was huge !!! Filled with chicken, pinto beans, Spanish rice, cheese and salsa. I could only finish half of it. It was delicious and very very filling. I had half of it for dinner didn't wanted to dump it. :) 

Grilled Chicken Pasilla Bowl - Loved it !!! They let you add and delete stuff that you don't like. I got mine with Mexican rice, pinto beans, salsa and grilled chicken. I skipped on the cheese and sour cream. Also, guacamole and fajitas can be added with few more bucks. 

They have a sauce counter just like any other Mexican counter with mild, medium, spicy, veggies and coriander. There are a few sitting tables but this place is good for take out !!!

Service is good and food is delicious would definitely go for lunch again !!! :)
author: Simran K.

description: Oh my gosh this place is insanely overpriced! Brown rice sub is +$2.25, peppers and onions to a bowl/salad +$3.00 ... I can't justify almost $15.00 for a bowl that is not even as good as chipotles' which is still under $10.00. I ordered the spicy chicken bowl (somehow spice is +0.50) and made it fajita style (peppers and onions), and did light rice and heavy lettuce. The ingredients themselves seemed fresh and pretty large portion that I couldn't finish in one sitting but that's not really something that stays well. Can't justify the price so onto other lunch places on Kearny.
author: Aryn C.

description:
Small little spot on the corner of Kearny and Pine, with a healthy menu. This is really a takeout joint although there's a couple seats if you don't prefer to eat at one of the cool public hidden spaces around the Fidi. 

I mostly order their salads (I ordered their tacos once which comes in threes and they're really just the most boring flaps of food ever). It comes with 2 dressing options: Chipotle and Lime, but they both were relatively creamy. I opted for salsa verde as my dressing instead. The salad comes with an abundance of stuff, so I usually have them hold the tortilla chips and cheese, and I add more jicama salsa (yum!) from the bar. As far as the protein selection goes, they have terribly dry chicken (and the spicy isn't even spicy) but the beef and pork are pretty tender and flavorful.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Wish I could give negative stars.
Sitting at my desk @work eating lunch, munching on a grilled marinated chicken breast Pasilla.  Chomped down on something hard, so I spit it out.  Thought it may have been a chicken bone.  When I spit it out, it looked like a nail.  On closer examination, it looks like a nail from a chicken claw.  It is literally the whole curved nail.
I walk back to Pasilla and asked for the manager.  Looks like there is no manager there.  I told the counterperson what happened and showed him the nail; he didn't seem like he cared, just said ok, it's abone.  I said, "no, if it was a bone, I wouldn't care so much.  It's a chicken nail.  The bowl I ordered was chicken breast, not chicken nail.  I'm informing you bc this is really gross."  He looked at the nail again and said "oh yeah huh?  It's a nail."  He then took my bag and threw my bag away.  Definately NOT coming back here...
author: N L.

description: I went there for takeout today and encountered rude service.  I ordered the lemon shrimp Pasilla bowl with brown beans.  I was given black beans and when I asked them to change it to brown beans, they literally scooped out the top of the bowl and put that on top of a bowl of brown beans, leaving half the salad in the old bowl.  How disgusting.  I didn't pay for Pasilla bowl with half the lettuce missing!!! When I asked the cashier to remake the entree, they gave me a dirty look. I suspected they might do something to my salad so I asked for my money back which generated more dirty looks and a comment, "I will give you your money but you don't need to say anything more." It a was very bad experience.  Not going back to that place again.
author: Susan L.

description: Really wanted to like this place more. I got the Shrimp Burrito bowl which was good at first. The flavors were on point, but about 3 bites in a realized none of the shrimp had been de-veined. I know some people don't mind that, but for me it was a big turn off. I picked through the remainder of the veggies but was rushing to eat a quick lunch and didn't want to mess with trying to clean them myself....  Not exactly what i had in mind. Bonus points - they have yummy salsa and service is friendly and FAST.
author: Shannon S.

description: This place is pretty solid. Under $10 and you can get a Burrito, Salad, Bowl or Quesadilla. There is an option for everyone here. The Salsa Bar has three sauces to choose from which is great. I would definitely eat here again. The burrito itself was filling and what I loved was they do not offer Refried Beans  ( meaning no lard ).
author: Kam H.

description:
Average at best for a San Francisco burrito joint.

Everything is fresh and service is very friendly. If you come before 11:30am on the weekdays you'll be in and out in under five minutes.

I usually get the grilled steak. It doesn't have much flavor but it's large and filling. For $9.00 it's on par for the rent in the area.

I will be back until there is something better.
author: Justin S.

description:
First time came here, and I'm craving for more.
This place is clean, they got a lot of different salsa.
I ordered Chicken Burrito.
The burrito was good, but not the best.
I would come back if I passed by this place..
I think maybe because of its cleanliness, the burrito doesnt taste authentic. lol.
author: Candice L.

description:
I love Pasilla's. Great location on Kearny and very accessible. You can't miss the green sign!

I'm a big fan of their steak salads. HUGE portions and so fresh! They do not skimp on the salad at all. It comes with tortilla chip fixings and everything else. If I'm in the mood for something more hearty, I'll grab their steak bowl and switch out the rice for quinoa. 

This place doesn't break the bank in comparison to other restaurants on this street and I've never had to wait too long for my order. Friendly staff, exceptional customer service, fresh ingredients...what's not to love?

PS: They have online ordering! You can order and pay online; pickup is usually within 10 mins - perfect for the walk over!
author: Vee B.

description:
Had steak tacos for lunch today, minus the cheese and sour cream to save on lactose (and sodium) -- still delicious.

Coworkers said the chips were a disappointment, so I'd pass on those, but their salads and burritos got good reviews.
author: Barack O.

description:
I came here for lunch on a weekday and it took 5-10 for me to order and get my food, which I was pleasantly surprised by. The restaurant essentially has no seating so you'll have to get take out.

 The restaurant is similar to chipotle except you get to manage some of your own toppings. They make you a pre-set bowl and you choose how much sauce, cilantro, lime, red onions you want in your bowl.

I got a shredded pork bowl and I really liked it! There was a good amount of meat so you feel like you get your money's worth. I wish I got a little bit more rice to make it a better balance so it's a small complaint.
author: Cassie Z.

description:
Just OK, it was fresh enough - I had the shrimp bowl $9.25 so a decent value for FiDi - but not too inspiring. The spicy sauce is not hot at all, btw.

There's better...
author: Massimo M.

description:
I've been to Pasilla a couple of times, every time I've gotten burritos (gotta love the gut busters)...

I've never had a bad experience with the staff, they are patient and friendly. The food is really good for the price in this area.  

Spicy chicken is lacking in spice haha but I guess if it was really spicy people wouldn't order it, other than that it's been a good burrito no complaints. Today I tried their garden burrito which I'm not a huge fan of squash or zucchini but man that was prolly one of the best veggie burritos I have had the flavors blend really well together it didn't even taste like their wasn't any meat!
author: Miguel C.

description: This place is similar to Chipotle, but tastes so much better. They use Mexican rice and other spices on the meat, that makes it much more flavorful. They also have a stand with other types of salsa and condiments for your burrito or bowl. Most items are under $10 so good fresh healthy food for a good price.
author: Saint M.

description:
Location location location. Pasilla is one of those restaurants where if they were located almost anywhere else, nobody would eat there. In the FiDi, now that El Faro has closed , there's almost no other Mexican fare. After my meal today though I'm definitely walking a couple blocks further to Chipotle for my Americanized sterilized tacos. 

There's this guy who always works at the register, he acts very bothered by all of the customers no matter how polite I am to him, he never smiles or talks politely to me, no eye contact, leaning on the counter like he can't stand his job. Today, even though it was the same degree of busy as it usually is during lunch- less than 5 minute line wait and less than 5 minute food wait, he was SCREAMING at the top of his lungs the order numbers and then what the order was, "NUMBER 135!!!!!! THREE CHICKEN TACOS WITH NO CHEESE AND CHIPS AND SALSA!!!!! 135!!! 135!!!!! NUMBER 136 PASILLA BOWL WITH EXTRA SOUR CREEEEAAAMMMM!!!!!!!!" So loud that I wanted to plug my ears. I have never seen him do that before and I have been in there when it was busier. 

As for the food, it is ridiculous that Pasilla cannot package the tacos in a better way for to-go orders, I mean come on it's 2014! ;) they slop three tacos in a piece of parchment that gets all soggy and FUBAR then wrap the whole thing in foil with no regard for what's happening to the taco integrity inside the aluminum wrap. Then they toss that ball of "have an effed up lunch" in a tiny paper lunch bag that they charge u 10 cents for, cuz it would really mess up their profit margin to get decent bags.

I can say that the fish tacos are good, they smelled a little extra fishy whn I got them but I didn't get sick- score! And I've had chicken pork and steal tacos that were decent. They offer soft corn, flour or crunchy tacos- they take us for fools by offering crunchy- a soft tortilla barely survives the abuse of their packaging, a crunchy taco might as well be put in the blender and poured in a glass. 

Today I got three tacos one chicken one steak and one pork. I took a bite of the pork, it tasted like the cooked it in water with not even a pinch of salt much less seasoning. So I moved on to the chicken, dry dry dry and just as flavorless, then I moved to the steak, a tiny bit better but still barely edible.
See my photo that shows their stupid packaging method and each taco having bites taken but not finished. That pic was right before they went dumpster diving. 

Another tip- they have what I call "fake chips" which means they are Tostitos or some store bought crap-not cool, a taqueria or restaurant will never get 5 stars from me no matter how good if they have fake chips!! Those chips have to be ridiculously cheap to be more cost effective than tortillas and oil. 

Whatever Pasilla, get it together.
author: Emma H.

description:
Got the chicken bowl ($9) with fajita (+$2). The bowl isn't even half filled so I was still hungry after. 
Very little rice. I mean come on, rice is cheap. 
The extra fajita (bell peppers) was not worth the $2. I can count they gave me 6 bell pepper shreds.
I have had burrito here before which is a good size and is cheaper than bowl. I am surprised the bowl is so unsatisfying.
author: Daniel C.

description: Really disjointed in the tacos here, do not get the shredded pork, my tacos were half empty and taste worse than Taco Bell.
author: Emily G.

description: The guy at the cash register often price gouges me. Ripped off many times in one month. As I go here daily I started to wonder why my price is different for Two tacos it should 6.50. Soda if u get a large fountain 2.25.  Add this 8$ and change, But I get hit for extra 4$ today higher then any other day.  I have assessed and asked why before his at whatever register prices change when I order the same thing two tacos and soda I don't mention quacamole, I ask for less sour cream, He tried to add 4$ extra guacamole and I don't eat extra guacamole! So for two tacos and a fountain soda, he broke the record I have different receipts showing different charges 6 different days This is like my first one I missed the over charge a few times. Some bag charges  wrong size drink charges, three taco plate 8.25 with added single tacos and now the 4$ I got a refund didn't take any food and will no longer go there.  Being  in the cash register business with CRS and East bay point of sales, in the past I can't believe even after addressing this last week with him? He thinks it's funny  he went to an all time high.  I don't have allot of money and everyone that takes advantage of mis charged because I happen to have tie on is not cool.    The food is good the nice lady gets it right every time with him it is different amount.   Ripped off .10 to 5$ in over pricing wrongful charges.   Check your receipts carefully.  I won't return to this place.  I verbally asked him today to refund blatant overcharge.
author: Charles E.

description: Great lunch spot for a good price burrito bowl. I do tend to get absolutely explosive shits after eating here which is why I deduct one star. I still go back after repeated stomach trauma, which tells you how good it tastes!
author: Dylan F.

description:
Great service, great food. I love their vegetarian bowls and burritos:)

I always shied away from Mexican food because I was feel so full after it but this place is great. Taste very fresh and despite the fact that it seems like an oxymoron, but I can eat a burrito and actually feel great after it.
author: andreas s.

description: I think they are rationing their beans and rice today. Skimpy bowl, not even half full. To their credit, they added more when I asked (not that I should have to ask), but there's not even a solid layer of beans and rice on the bottom. Usually, they're alright, but I won't be going back anytime soon. Too bad.
author: B H.

description:
I have been to this restaurant once or twice. The food is average but the people working there are awful. As in rude and disrespectful at least to me. I work in the neighborhood and one day this week I decided to get a burrito after work. There was one other customer waiting for their food. I placed an order for their Lemon garlic prawn burrito and paid. As I was waiting for my order at least three other people came behind me and guess who got their food first? All three of the customers who came after me! The staff looked at me after they served the third customer to see if I noticed. I went up to the counter and asked about my order and they made some excuse about why it took so long. 

Then today I decided to call in the order and go pick up during my lunch break. He told me it would be ten minutes and I told them I would go after twenty five minutes. I went after about forty five minutes and he told me in a very rude and disrespectful tone that it was not ready. I was like but you told me it would be ready in forty five minutes. He just shrugged his shoulders. Clearly they did not want my business. I wear a scarf for religious purposes and I get a lot of dirty looks from people and I noticed that from the staff here. Clearly the 'latinos' at this establishment love serving the European-American clientele. Fine with me, I will never set foot in this place ever again. I will go to the many restaurants on Kearney and spend my money only in places where I am treated with respect and feel welcome.
author: Eden T.

description: Pasilla is a nice alternative to Chipotle in FiDi, and it's open for dinner! Same idea but different ingredients/flavors. There's a huge variance in healthiness depending on how you're feeling, everything from a quinoa burrito bowl to a yummy cheesy burrito. Ordering here is a little more confusing because you have to tell the cashier exactly what you want unlike the 'supply chain' format which I think works better when there's a lot of options. I personally find it to be a little more food than Chipotle for a little more expensive. Definitely a grab and go type of place.
author: Connie Q.

description: Im the pickiest eater this place has all the Americanized Mexican options salads bowls etc but so fresh. I get my same order I used to have at chipotle without feeling sick. They slice all the veggies there fresh. Very impressed I've been back twice
author: Liz J.

description:
2.5 stars (edited to 3 stars, see below)

I had some weird toothpick, or plastic fork edge inside of my buritto. I posted the photo and my receipt in here. Called and am currently waiting for a manager to return my message. Glad I didn't bite down too hard or swallow it. Not the lawsuit kinda guy and just hoping for a refund.

Staff was nice. Burrito had decent enough spice. Slightly better than el faro across the street. Not sure I willl eat here again. Eat at your own risk.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Update the next day on speaking with the manager, Lisa. She was very apologetic on the phone and I met with her the next day. I simply asked for a refund and she kindly gave it to me, as well as a free meal. I tried the same burrito again out of good faith and it was good. Not quite 3.5 stars but I will give it a solid 3. Sounds like the piece of fork or whatever was actually a piece of bone after closer looking at it. 

My final review on this place is 3 stars. The staff is attentive and friendly and the food is no worse than 3 but no better either. Accidents happen and I will not hold it against them.
author: Nate B.

description:
I went here one time for lunch during a work day. My friend recommended the burrito bowl they do here. Same concept as Chipotle but it's not an assembly line. You just order what you want and they put everything they would normally put into their burritos in a bowl. 

We took the food to go so I can't say much about the decor. This location is in a corner building with a wide open entrance which feels inviting but it also open to city elements and insects. I have mixed feelings about it. 

I have to say in terms of quality ingredients this place blows Chipotle out of the water. Their meat is flavorful and juicy and doesn't get lost in the fold of all the other burrito ingredients. When I eat burrito bowls from elsewhere each bite tastes exactly the same. Here I can identify the unique ingredients and the flavor profile each one brings to the table. As far as price it is cheaper than Chipotle and on a similar level in terms of the amount of food you get.

All in all I would definitly come back here if I'm craving a burrito bowl.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Came here for lunch because it's near my office. During lunch hour, this place is pretty hectic as all the people in FiDi are rushing in and out, but despite this, service is still pretty fast.

I got the pulled pork quesadillas and chips. They have a serve your own salsa bar on the side and the place is pretty simple--probably because I'm guessing most of their customers just buy food and then leave. I thought the pulled pork was actually pretty spectacular, and I'm not even typically a fan of Mexican food. It was super juicy, tender, and soft and just all around delicious. The portion size is also huge! They served it in a take out box so it was just stacked on top of each other but I was easily full after having 2 of the 3 slices that they gave. Super cheesy and flavorful, and just generally solid. At $7.75, that's pretty good for lunch.

tldr; yummy Mexican food to go! can be a little hectic but food actually comes out pretty quickly
author: Jasmine X.

description: Very mediocre food. Pork burrito was really bland. Poorly seasoned meat. Poorly seasoned rice. Generic tortilla. This place is super, uber, Meh. I Would pass.  Guacamole is good but tiny portion.
author: David G.

description:
Personally I'm not a big fan of Mexican food but these guys make it really good. I've had nothing but good experiences with this place. 

There are very few places around Financial district that actually have decent food and Pasilla is definitely one of them. 90% of times I want to have a quick lunch in downtown area I head down to this restaurant. 

Spicy fish salad and fish tacoes are my two favorites although they recently added an option to replace rice with Quinoa so now I enjoy the burrito bowl as well! Not sure if $2 for quinoa is a fair deal though.

The only reason for four stars instead of five is for the seating problem. The restaurant gets packed during lunch but there are literally only two tables to sit down. The place is small it I have no choice but order "take out".
author: Van G.

description:
I have been to Pasilla Mexican Grill only once and that was my last time. I asked them to add Fajitas to my Vegetarian burrito that they didn't do. I got the burrito with rice, beans and salsa that was below average.

Maybe this place is decent for meat lovers but not recommended for vegetarians.
author: Jay M.

description: Walked by this kind of unassuming place and had to go back and try the food.  It was great!  Way more flavorful than typical big chain burritos.  I had a burrito with steak and black beans and all the rest of the ingredients.  All were fresh and delicious.  The Salsa Bar was a treat, along with the pickled jalapeños.  You could adjust the spice to just the right level for yourself.
author: George W.

description: Bad customer service !!! One of the lady in there  i think she's the owner so damn rude !!
author: Sokmey L.

description:
Hey this is the place on the corner on Kearny and Pine where you can go if you are tired of waiting 1 hour in line to get into that Ramen place 2 doors down. 

It is mostly a Take-Away type place (Take-Away, that's British for To-Go), but they do have 3 tiny tables and a few chairs. Looks like it is family run. 

I ordered a Spicy Chicken Quesadilla. This is not your tidy Chipotle type serving. It was dripping in greasy goodness and chili oil, and was fresh and hot off the griddle. I had to use a lot of napkins even after finger licking the triangles down my Quesadilla Pie Hole.  

I woofed that down in minutes while the people down the street inched toward their bowl of Ramen for another 45 minutes.
author: Wanugee N.

description: This is probably one of my best Mexican food where I can get the same great taste again and again. Chicken items are very tender and fresh. Just love the food. Simply the best
author: Chetan S.

description: Crispy tacos (I know...) were fast but not fresh (the shells especially), creative or filling.
author: Jon F.

description:
Food ok, guac ok, everything is just ok, to me it tasted sorta like chipotle but with slight more flavor, but different flavor. It was definitely edible and fresh tasting, just not too good. I was not a fan of the rice, but the gripped chicken was good, I am slightly disappointed overall.

If I'm gonna settle for bland Mexican food I'll settle for chipotle, at least their guac is amazing. 

Over all, ok.
Probably won't return, however it is a possibility.

The staff being super nice is a huge pro
author: Imani T.

description:
I frequent Pascilla because of its location.

I only order their vegetarian options but they taste wonderful; bowl, burrito or salad!

Most items are perfectly proportioned except for the salad. Its unnecessarily large. I do recommend the Chipotle Adobo dressing though, haha.

Amazing guacamole, like, amazing.. Really. Chips, eh..
author: Chaniece D.

description:
A new co-worker of mine used to come here a lot, and eventually wrangled a crew of us into walking up to Pasilla with her.

Here's the breakdown:

Cons:
- The space is pretty cramped. There's minimal room to sit and they don't really have a good way of separating people waiting to order from people waiting for food, so it can feel cramped and chaotic during the lunch rush.
- In the midst of the lunch rush, the staff was pretty bad about getting people their food. Orders were piling up on the counter and one guy was hyper-focused on taking someone's order, and couldn't take the single second necessary to call out a number. If he can't multitask, they should assign someone to handle distribution. One of the people in our group ended up standing there for 5 minutes just waiting without realizing her food had been sitting 2 feet away from her the whole time. 5 minutes is usually not a lot but in in a cramped, loud lunch place, it's an era.

Pros:
+ The food here is GREAT. The portions are huge and delicious. 
+ They also have a great salsa bar with tons of little to-go cups, so you can load up on salsa and jicama salad to your heart's desire.
+ Prices are really reasonable and you could easily have leftovers for a second day of lunch. 

 Overall, I think it was worth the 10-minute walk from our office to grab lunch here, but I would want to come on a nice sunny day when I could take a long lunch and find an outdoor table in the neighborhood.
author: Rachel A.

description:
I Agree with Mark D. This place is tiny! it literally has 8 chairs! I counted. Definitely better for takeout than dine in. Luckily, I went at an extremely odd hour - 3.30pm. Most other food joints were closed or cleaning up for the evening so I stumbled on this joint by accident and laziness (didn't want to walk too far). 

Basically, you can either do a Bowl, Burrito or Taco. They have the options of grilled marinated chicken, spicy chicken, fish, pulled pork etc. 

I chose a Taco because they offer the soft flour ones! and also I wasn't that hungry. With tacos you get less in quantity. If you are starving... Go for the BOWLS! 

Overall, it was pretty average. Cubes of grilled chicken breast (not as good as chipotle's). Some slices of lettuce. Salsa & sour cream on the side as per my request. I felt like I could easily have whipped this up at home too! But since I wasn't expecting any thing spectacular in the first place. I wasn't disappointed either.
author: Amanda L.

description: One of the best steak burritos in SF. I eat hear every time I'm in the financial area. Love it!
author: Fabian M.

description: My burrito was Dry. %$%@#@*^&%  I had a veggie burrito with all the fixings.   ?????  And they charged me .10 for a bag, and didn't even ask me if I wanted a bag.  I sat down inside and ate it right away - I didn't even need the bag.   I will never go back.
author: Janet J.

description:
Two months ago I got a chicken burrito and added guac. Got back to my office and realized they didn't add the guacamole to my burrito. I still got charged $2. 

Today I went back to give them another chance. Got the pork burrito (below average pork) and asked for guacamole.

My receipt shows $2 for guacamole. They were able to read the black beans request but couldn't read the $2 for guacamole that was located just above the black beans text.

If you want an average burrito and to pay $2 for guacamole that won't be there, then Pasilla is your spot.
author: Tyler S.

description: I got a salad for dinner after my class in Chinatown. Decent amount of protein.  The cilantro vinaigrette was really tasty with the spicy pasilla chicken.  Good sized salad that I may make the trek to get for lunch.  The salad comes with tortilla chips in the salad that I thought were going to be crispy tortilla strips, but the menu did NOT lie, they were literally chips thrown into the salad...a little odd considering the chips were low quality yellow corn tortilla chips.  Next time if I get a salad I will ask for no chips. The staff was really friendly and even remade an order for a vegan who forgot to ask for no cheese.
author: Kimberly D.

description: They shouldn't be in business of serving Mexican food. Meat is always overcooked, veggies are always too raw and sauces are flavorless. I have tried there prawn and chicken dishes. Taco Bell burritos taste better than there's.
author: Vishal T.

description:
I was craving some mexican food near work, I was a little hesitant based on the yelp reviews (in my experience, mexican around 3-3.5 stars can be pretty variable depending on where you are) but this place was definitely a pleasant surprise. I got the veggie burrito with jalapenos, and it was solid. Beans, cheese, rice, guac, sour cream, all for around 8 bucks (including tax!) - and everything is flavored pretty nicely. I'm definitely coming back to this place, the only question is when.

Also, some of my meat eating friends enjoyed it too - so it's not just for vegetarians like me
author: Amaresh S.

description: Nice spot on Kearny for a quick lunch or dinner for work. The portions are pretty large. Got a single taco and it was huge, can't imagine having three of them, as they normally come. My main gripe about the place is that things were really salty. I got the regular grilled chicken taco and it was too salty for my taste. But, do NOT skip out on the guacamole and chips here. Definitely worth it. Fresh and delicious. Sure, your breath will suffer, but your stomach will be willing to apologize to your coworkers on its behalf.
author: Annie S.

description:
It's really a 3.5, but their salsas def bump it up to a 4. 

I had the chicken burrito and enjoyed it. Semi-authentic flavors, but no comparison to a burrito in the Mission. Better than Chipotle? YES. On par with Cancun or El Farolito? Not even close. 

Would I come back again? Probably. But the long lunch line kinda fooled me into thinking I'd have a burrito from the Gods.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
Better than Chipotle but, not by much.

I came here because I was in the neighborhood, it was late, and not much else was open. The only reason I mentioned Chipotle is because everything going on in here is reminiscent of it.

The food is slightly better and the service was friendly and fast.

While I wouldn't seek this place out, I'd probably come back if under similar circumstances.
author: Paul D.

description: This is a solid Chipotle substitute but not a foodie spot. Pasilla is higher quality than Chipotle and has better meat. If you are from out of town.. dont come here, but if you work in the neighborhood, its a good lunch option.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Pasilla Mexican Grill has a lot in common with Chipotle.  If you like the burritos at Chipotle, I am pretty sure you would like the burritos at Pasilla.  This is more your city slicker burrito than your big kitchen sink mess of a burrito that you get at a hole in the wall in the Mission.

1.  Spicy Chicken Burrito - This was a good burrito.  The ingredients were fresh and the burrito was put together well.  The chicken was tender.  Personally, if I return, I will probably get the normal chicken burrito.  The spicy chicken did have a smoky flavor to it but there was something I didn't quite like about it.  Overall though, it was still a good burrito.

http://tinyurl.com/6xofefo

2.  The chips and guacamole (especially the guacamole) are very similar to Chipotle. The guacamole was fresh with the primary flavors being avocado and lime.  The chips were good but not world class.

http://tinyurl.com/6a3r5xf

3.  They do have a small sauce bar with around four different sauces.  Their medium and hot salsas were good.  There was also a fresh jicama salsa that looked unique. I should have tried it but didn't.

4.  The place is small.  Probably sits only around 8 people.  So, it is better suited for carry out.  It is clean and neat though.

5.  The service was friendly, polite, and fast.  I went in a slow period though.  I am not sure how they hold up when it is busy.

Overall, I would return.  It is a pretty good burrito made from fresh ingredients.
author: Mark D.

description:
Holy Huge Salad!
 
I ordered the spicy chicken salad and it came in a huge tub with a ton of chicken, plus cheese, corn, black beans, jicima, tomatoes, onions, peppers and pepitas.  I don't normally like mixed greens (the texture is weird), but I didn't even mind b/c everything else tasted so good!  I got the chipotle dressing (sort of like chipotle ranch) and also added some green and hot salsa.  YUM!  If you like salads (and with a little kick), this is your place to go!
author: Anna E.

description:
I was impressed with the Burrito Bowl I got here. I tried the Spicy Chicken and was pleasantly surprised the used chicken breast. It was tasty, flavorful and very filing. I really like the jicama slaw on the salsa bar.
Glad to have found an alternative to Chipotle.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
On first inspection Pasilla appears to be an off-brand Chipotle. On further inspection, Pasilla is basically an off-brand Chipotle.

Burrito bowls are Chipotle-big and Chipotle-priced. The menu items are suspiciously similar to Chipotle's. 

If you're looking for a Chipotle but cannot or do not want to go to a Chipotle you should consider Pasilla. 

Similarly, if you are looking for Pasilla but are not near Pasilla- I would recommend trying out Chipotle.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Another word to describe Pasilla has got to be PLAIN... Boring might be a close second. 

I've come here twice for lunch with coworkers and left pretty disappointed both times. The burritos and tacos are bland and lack any flavor whatsoever. I felt like I was eating a blob of tasteless carbs. Even ordering the dishes extra spicy doesn't do a thing and the ingredients feel stale. 

Definitely avoid Pasilla if you can - make the trek over to Chipotle or maybe even Tlaloc instead. 

Tip - it's take out only as there aren't any tables to eat there.
author: Priya S.

description:
Pasilla Mexican Grill was a happy discovery during a working lunch 

Manager brought in burrito bowls for the team & at first I was thinking, hmmm, okay I'll give it a try but OMG were these things deeelish! 

Veggie Burrito Bowl - black beans, seasoned rice, cool sour cream, creamy guac, diced tomatoes & fresh, crunchy, shredded lettuce.....no skimping on any of the bowl fillings & 1/2 the bowl will fill you up all day - no need for dinner! 

Went back about a week later & didn't have such 5-star reaction but it was still a strong 4-star worthy & I gobbled it up, no problem 

Also indulged in their chips & experienced their Salsa Bar..... let's just say their hot is HOT. Me likey! 

Maybe I'll do a best out of 3 & re-review after another yummy veggie bowl - I suspect they justify a full 5 stars
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Spicy chicken tacos, mmmmmmm.

While you can't really compare this place to the Taqueria's in the mission, I like to think of this place as a better tasting Chipotle (sans the up front assembly line) where the ingredients are a little more fresh and flavorful. This is my go to spot as it's right across the street from my office.

The staff here always has a smile and is especially friendly to their regulars.
author: Ed D.

description:
Not totally authentic if you compare this with a taqueria, but it sure beats the Chipotle places that are dotted around the Bay Area. 

Had a Pollo burrito, no beans and a drink. Under $10, so I'm happy. Food is fresh and the staff were patient and friendly since I am one who takes awhile to make up my mind. 

My only complaint is that my tortilla melted a bit when I opened it. I think it was the sour cream that got to it first. I should tell them I want a pollo soup next time. :P
author: Jason C. J.

description: I always take my food to go as the space is small and it gets really crowded. I like the Pasilla Bowl with Quinoa, Chicken and such. Really great option, super filing.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Got a steak burrito.

- Pretty big, pretty filling.
- Not hugely flavorful, but tasty.
- Fast service.
- Decor is nice as far as take-out goes. They have a few tables to eat at, but eating there seemed like it might be awkward.
author: Ceasar B.

description:
3.5 stars

Got the steak bruitto bowl. Steak was very flavorful and instead of rice added quinoa. It was $10. It may not look like much, but when you are eating it, they actually give you a decent amount. 

They have very fast service. You order and pay. Wait a little bit and your food is ready in 5 mins. Don't forget to grab the different salas they have.
author: Karen H.

description:
I moved to SF almost two years ago and have been trying to find my favorite burrito in the city.  I have say that this one comes pretty close.  Disclaimer:  I am a vegetarian, so I cannot comment on meat quality, tastiness, etc, but the veggie burrito is delish!  It is BIG, full of beans and guac, and they make it spicy for you by putting some chilli peppers in the rice.  

The quesadillas are also really good when you are drunk and in the mood for lots of messy cheese.
author: Rao P.

description: The salad was huge but the price seemed a bit much.  I would actually prefer if they had a smaller/cheaper option.  Overall though the chicken in it was delicious and the salsa I got from the salsa bar and used as dressing complimented it well.  I would maybe return here if I happened to be in the area.  It really is another Chipotle without the chain and same price.
author: Amanda K.

description: The food is delicious and authentic. We had their grilled marinated steak bowl, chicken breast burrito, pork quesadilla, and lemon garlic prawn burrito. Everything was wonderful. Their salsas are amazing!!!Slow, fire, roasted and delicious. MAKES Chipotle tasye like Taco Bell.
author: Ana C.

description: Burritos are always decent and very filling. I usually go with the pork or chicken and been satisfied every time.
author: Dilly M.

description:
Started a new job in the financial district recently. Being a burrito hound, I've been on a mission to try all the nearby burrito options. I've tried 5+ so far (e.g. Orale, Orale, Alex's Gourmet) and Pasilla is the best one I've tried so far (full disclosure: twice). Exceptional veggie burrito. Pretty good chips and salsa. And most importantly, they are not cheap with the guacamole. They also offer wheat tortilla. Overall, the taste is very good and the service is quick. For FiDi, can't really beat that combo. 

Best place to get a quick burrito in downtown SF that I've tried so far.
author: Rick P.

description: A small burrito that is OK tasting for 8 and a half bucks. Screw this. If you want guacamole it's 10 bucks.
author: Guru T.

description:
(See pic)

More of 3.3 stars.

A busy morning of work that I needed a good walk to refresh my mind and get some crisp air outside.

It's definitely chilly outside and I wanted something spicy to spice me up! Seeing Mexican food is like mmM!

I got the spicy chicken quesadillas which was very tasty and spicy. Good amount of melted cheese and fairly spicy chicken. Good thing they have the sour cream to helpl my otherwise sweaty nose.

Also had the sizzling bubbly Jarriotos Mandarina. The girl was jokingly asking if she should open the bottle because it's not a twist. I joked back saying yes because my teeth don't work too well.

The place is clean and needless to say, the service is very very friendly.

Like many mentioned, the higher than usual step to the eatery is probably due to the steep street and I doubt this shop specifically did it.
author: T L.

description: My husband and I ordered from Pasilla one night after work. It was delicious, simple, easy and they delivered. We ordered a quesadilla and a burrito, as well as a side of guac and chips. Everything had a nice flavor and was reasonably priced. We were pleased with everything and will order again when we need a quick, easy, relatively healthy option for lunch or dinner.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I was craving some sloppy good tacos today and I gave this place a try. There isn't alot of choices around downtown financial district and the taco truck at  Pacific Ave was getting boring. Anyhow, my coworkers were headed towards Baladis so I figured I'd give Pasilla a shot. 

I ordered the spicy chicken tacos, which comes in a group of 3's. I didn't bother asking if they let you mix and match, but my guess is that they will since all the other meat choices are $6.50. The tacos are nothing to write home about, but the ingredients include lettuce, spicy chicken, salsa, tomatos, and a mild sauce likely from the chicken. This all came out to $7.12 after tax, which is reasonable considering the area. The taste was probably just below Baja Fresh, if you've ever been there. They have a small salsa bar so you can load up like a bandit with verde, medium, and or hot sauce. I took it all, just in case the chicken was dry. The chicken is borderline dry, but probably made a deal with the spicy sauce which made it ok.

As a side note, the dude working the counter had a 'Working Girls' t-shirt on, so I wonder if they are the same owner?
author: Wil M.

description:
Fish tacos. Nothing special, just plain white fish. Its nice that they are not priced out of the world. 

The three tacos came out in just foil - no box or anything. When I opened it, it was all mushy and mixed together and had to be eaten with a fork and knife.

Chips are -not- free.

Not coming back
author: Greg M.

description: Don't let the location fool you. Although it's in Chinatown, the food is decent Mexican food. Good portion sized meals and tasty. I would give it five stars but it's a little on the pricey side.
author: Kirk C.

description:
I hate this place. I give them a chance every month or so and I am continually disappointed. The burrito is terrible and the fish tacos have marinated and grilled fish (yay) but the amount of fish is about a two-inch by one-inch piece in each taco. $8.75 for that? 

The salsas, while fresh, taste like they just threw a bunch of ingredients into a blender in teh morning. Inconsistant and not very flavorful 

Im never coming here again... until next week.
author: Adam L.

description: I walked in moments before closing time and the service was still excellent. The burrito was very good, similar to Chipotle.
author: Tal E.

description: I love this place. They food is always fresh and delicous. they have an amazing salsa bar and they are always adding new and fun but healthy options to the menu. The staff is great really friendly and quick service.. great lunch spot in fidi
author: Joe A.

description:
I think "okay" sums up this place in every aspect basically. Always there, never outstanding. In this area there are better places to sate a burrito craving...like Caramba on 2nd street.

To clarify, I've tried several types of burrito and quesadilla here, found all serviceable.
author: Dara K.

description: Good spot.  Nothing out of the ordinary or especially stand out but a good Mexican joint with some pretty tasty burritos.
author: Blake B.

description: Better than chipotle, fast and cheap. You're not here for the ambiance, you're here because you want to devour a great burrito bowl and get back to work -- and that's exactly what you'll get. The salsa bar was nice, not that spicy though. The burritos are heavy on rice, but the meat that it does have is juicy and flavourful, well seasoned as well.
author: Ved P.

description: Fresh ingredients, friendly staff and quick service. Very filling and not expensive. Best flavor we had on our entire trip in San Fran!
author: Alexis H.

description:
Salsa bar? Check.
Friendly staff? Check.
Burrito big enough for two lunches for less than $8? Check.

When I want a burrito for lunch downtown, this is my go-to spot.  Yes, there are about 10 Chipotles within a 5 block radius, but Pasilla burritos are better AND they have a salsa bar. Done and Done.
author: Liz H.

description:
Big fan! Quesadillas are the best thing, I think. Burritos are a great size. About the same price as chipotle but tastes slightly more authentic (eh, barely).

Salsa bar is decent, but then again I only get the hot salsa and jalepenos. 

Overall, go--you won't be disappointed. It's nothing out of this world either, though. :)
author: Omid F.

description:
Nothing amazing, but large portion size for a fair price earn Pasilla a four instead of a three. 

Burrito and tacos were above average and I always love places with radishes in their salsa bar. Service was also prompt.

Only negative is this place is small, so around certain hours it isn't always possible to find a seat.
author: Binh D.

description: Stopped by here for lunch one day and ordered the vegetarian taco salad. This salad was gigantic and came with a ton of guacamole and other vegetables. It was really reasonably priced, I think about 8 bucks, for the amount of food I received. I definitely want to go back and try some of their other food options.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I'll give credit where credit is due...the marinated chicken is muy bueno.  However, what do I look like having to pay $1.75 for guacamole on what's otherwise a super burrito? Why is guacamole only served on the vegetarian burrito? Can we say RIP-OFF CHIPOTLE?! Not to mention the teenie tinie "Salsa Bar"...smh I'll make sure to hit up the Food Court should I desire a burrito while at work!!!
author: Amoura B.

description:
Excellent chicken bowl! I usually skip lettuce filler from this dish but otherwise it is very good! Home make fresh salsas and especially their Jicima salad is fantastic. Grilled jalapenos is a new zesty addition to my old favorite Mexican bowl. 

Chicken nicely grilled and black beans well drained, so you don't get soupy,sloppy  and soggy mess as you get it at El Faro across the street. The entire menu is simple and well designed. 

Quality is good made home cooking and I like it this way.
author: Xela H.

description:
It was just below okay. Staff was very friendly but that burrito wasn't.
Probably wont go back even though it is quite a popular place.
It didn't work out for me, maybe it will for you.
author: Mark N.

description: I like the food here, but they have lost my order before and did not offer anything for the 25 minutes I had to wait.  Not even an apology.  Luckily I was with a group of people who all got pissed off as well and none of us will be going back.  You need to at least say sorry and offer a bag of chips.
author: Pele N.

description:
I eat lunch on Kearny St. every day and this place is where you want to go. 

Great tasting and they get the order right and made quick. The restaurant's layout sucks but is just part of being a small burrito place: definitely get it to go.

WAAY BETTER THAN CHIPOTLE
author: Chris T.

description:
Consistently horrible service with only mediocre food.

Just tried giving the place another shot but it  was miss.  The place lost my order, messed up a friends, and the food was bad.  On top of it when the order was most the clerk did not even offer to expedite it.

Stay away. There are other better Mexican restaurants.
author: Ariel B.

description: Very consistent and solid lunch option in FiDI
author: Matt C.

description: tiny but good price & a delicious burrito. definitely going to be going back.
author: Jack D.

description: I you're going to pretend to be Chipotle, at least make it a better alternative. Just go to Chipotle instead, you'll pay less and the food will taste better. $1.25 for Fajita Vegetables is ridiculous considering Chipotle includes it.
author: Sharat S.

description:
$7 for a veggie bowl that feels like it weighs 3lbs -- not bad!  I'd say 1/3 of it was guacamole which is SO rare when these days places will charge an extra $2 for a slice of avocado.  And if you ask for extra lettuce it's free.. what a concept in this city.  Pretty large salsa bar includes a yummy and refreshing jicama salad.

Will be back :)

**Update: OMG it's sooo much food!! I tried to eat at least half the veggie bowl but it's too much and my belly is bulging now :\
author: s m.

description:
RUDE!  I recommend going to Tlaloc http://sabormexicano.com/tlaloc/ - it's a bit further out but the food is MUCH better and the staff there are always friendly and never rude like these folks. I'll take the extra walk next time and avoid this place all together!

To Pasilla Employees - out of respect, at least in my culture (I'm Mexican)  when someone speaks to you in Spanish, you respond to them in Spanish, otherwise it's considered rude and disrespectful... and then to top it off, to be ridiculed and laughed at when I'm giving you business; for shame!
author: Nora L.

description:
I had the Cubano sandwich.  Its was deee-licious.  The sandwich itself is medium size.  but the flavor rocked...the toasting of the bread and the meats was tasty, tasty.  Im a grown man.  I've moved beyond "that sandwich was huge" mentality.  The flavor and consistency plays a big part in my selection.  I enjoyed it very much.  I want to give it a four star...but how can I from a sandwich? 

The place is nice and inviting.   Folks there seemed very cool.  I'll be back again soon.  It may just be a regular joint for me.
author: C O.

description:
I agree wtih Adam B. about people comparing this place to a taqueria in the mission. Yea its not the most authentic taqueria around and no they dont play La Rasa in the background but they do offer you fresh ingrediants and tastey food.

Working downtown it can get difficult to run around and find something you might feel like eating for lunch. I mean how many times have you guys gone to eat a teriyaki bowl or a subway sandwich? In the beginning yea its not that bad but after awhile you just wish there was something else.

Pasilla does just that, look Ive never stepped into a Chipotle and I dont know what they serve in there...probably mexican food duh. Im givng this place 4 stars for a couple reasons.

Service - helpful and very friendly
Price - 10bucks or less including drink
Location - its about a block and half from where i work
Food - fresh ingrediants and good taste

Pasilla beats the usual of those deli shops and teriyaki places and its always nice to have a wider selection of eateries to choose from for lunch~
author: phillip w.

description:
Pleased.

I was on my way home from my unknowingly first day at a brand new job when I saw this place.  Wasn't it a pizza place before?  I wanted something filling and comforting to nourish me after a day of re-orientation and work.  Steak. Burrito. Black beans.  Everything. To go.  And I got all of those things in about 10 minutes.  The staff was friendly and invited me to try their salsa.

Home.  Burrito was wrapped to eat with your hand (clever) but I'm more of a fork and knife person.  I loved it, just the right amount of flavors, moist and filling.  This is the first time I've eaten a whole burrito in one setting.  Some good stuff.

Four burritos.  Now only if the order came with some free chips.
author: Jen L.

description: This is the best burrito in the Fidi area for lunch. I like the spicy chicken burrito. Food is fresh and served fast. Better than El Faro across the street and Chipotle.
author: K M.

description: I would normally give this place 3 stars, but I ordered a vegetarian burrito with no guacamole and discovered after walking back to work that it is loaded with the stuff. No bueno.
author: Zachary W.

description: Mmmmm, mmmmm, friggin' mmmmmm.  Pasilla is so amazing.  The fresh flavor of every ingredient makes anything you order here absolutely delicious.  I've gone through the chicken quesadilla, steak burrito, slow roasted pork burrito, and chicken burrito.  Now chicken is something I rarely ever get in my burrito.  Steak, pork, barbacoa, anything but chicken.  Not because I dislike chicken.  I love chicken.  I just seem to always favor the dark meat.  Sue me.  Anyway, chicken!  Of the four exquisite meals I've had the chicken burrito is the most amazing.  I literally rolled my eyes in immense pleasure when I bit into this.  What else is great about Pasilla?  Portions: huge.  I've never finished one serving in one day.  And the flavors retain magically when re-heated.  Prices: inexpensive.  Especially considering you can stretch your dollar out thanks to their generosity.  I love this place.  It's my new go to burrito joint.
author: Nick J.

description: I had a sub-par burrito here for $10. Never again. Just go to El Faro across the street and save some money.
author: Gina B.

description: After working two blocks away for the past 6 months I never took a second look at this place. I am from Texas but Mexican food is not my favorite, but my new MOGL app made me try this place. I was not disappointed. I ordered the spicy chicken bowl with peppers and onions added and the flavor was delicious! I gave four stars because there was not as much rice as I would have liked. The bowl was really perfect because I am cutting carbs anyway. I will go back again and again!
author: Jazmyn W.

description: This place has one lame burrito. Pork was chewy and dry. Burrito itself was dripping wet with hopefully tomatoes or salsa, but halfway through it's almost inedible. The guy asked me if I wanted "spicy", so I said yes but it wasn't spicy at all. Sad state of burrito affairs in downtown SF.
author: Dean I.

description:
Working in the financial district and only having an hour for lunch doesn't leave too many options. I usually bring my lunch as I am one of the pickiest eaters you will find. But my coworker had suggested this place and said it was kinda chipotle style so I said okay. Sooo much better than chipotle. It's the same kind of idea: burritos, burrito bowls and tacos. Everything tastes fresher than chipotle and they have a salsa bar. I ordered the vegetarian burrito bowl. It had the usual stuff, everything that would be in a burrito--minus the tortilla. It was pretty delicious and I was completely stuffed after eating about half of it. 

Great place for a quick lunch and yummy too.
author: Cherie A.

description:
Usually I have a good experience here.  But I have only been here 3 times in the past.  I always get helped by a nice lady that's always friendly.  Today I was helped by her and besides not being able to mix and match taco types (-1 star) she was friendly.  As I was waiting for my food, they call a number and I ask what number she called.  The counter guy with a moustache was a total dick (-3).  He stepped in to a conversation that didn't involve him and wasn't even nice about it.  He didn't even ask me what my number was and just said it's your order and to take it and leave.  So I took it and left.  i knew I should have walked down to the Kung Fu Taco truck.  

Needless to say, I won't be coming back.  There are plenty of other taco places in the area.
author: Scott B.

description: Great food! Not much in the way of seating, but it's perfect for grabbing lunch and bringing it back to the office.
author: Aaron S.

description: Not bad at all. Just had the super carne asada burrito the meat had a good flavor and tasted fresh. I'd eat here again.
author: Jarrett C.

description: Steak burrito was delicious with just the right amount of spicy salsa on it. It also had good amount of cheese, which I happen to love. The beans were flavorful and the tortilla had a nice texture. They have a fresh jicama salsa that cooled down the heat when needed at the lovely salsa bar.  Salsa bar had roasted pasilla peppers. I did not try them this time but other people did, so I am guessing they are good. You do have to purchase the chips separately, though. Much better and a bit less expensive than Chipotle.
author: Nichole G.

description:
Fresh, friendly and fast.  They have wheat tortillas and vitamin water zero. A block from my place. 
What more could I ask for?
author: Courtney M.

description: I came for the first time and was impressed. Didn't know what to expect, but the flavors was flavorful and delishes. Also the price was fair!
author: Larry F.

description:
This place is like Chipotle minus the uncomfortable chairs, barbocoa and long line. What makes me sad is that they couldn't even try to think out of the box a little tiny bit. 
The pasilla chicken burrito was passable-it's suppose to be spicy and maybe I'm biased but it was nowhere what I expected to be spicy but they have a salad bar thank God. 
The service is friendly, they try to push guacamole which I wouldn't recommend and the rice is definitely too watery and sticky-kind of like porridge. If you're looking for burritos or tacos, just stick it out till you're in the Mission but otherwise prepare for a medicore lunch with watered down salsa.
author: Jessica K.

description:
I finally tried this place today, it's right around the corner from the temporary offices my company has while our building is being renovated.

It looked clean and decent, so I stepped in.

I ordered the Steak Burrito.   I regret that decision.

It tasted fine, however shortly thereafter I got what every person dreads - food poisoning.  And there is nothing worse that having food poisoning at work.  I was sent home of course and am in bed now as I write this review.
author: Jen K.

description:
By far the cleanest, cutest, tastiest fast "mexican" in the fidi. Better than Chipotle, open later than all the others, and the owner is the sweetest man ever. The salsa's spicy and delicious, the crispy tacos aren't greasy, and things move quickly so you're in and out in no time at all. 

For $6 we got enough crispy tacos (3) for two hungry people. Stuffed with all-breast meat and an abundance of green things, that's a great deal. I haven't paid less than $10 for a soft drink in the fidi before walking into Pasilla. Plus, the service is polite and the food is actually very tasty. Tortilla chips are also not the cheap yucky big-plastic-bag-from-costco chips you get at most taquerias, nor are they drenched in grease. 

I'll be back! Conveniently located between work and the 1 California, we're going to get to know eachother very well.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Finally! a mexican joint in the financial district!

Pasilla serves what you would call "white man's" mexican food, but I am very appreciative of its accessibility. Their menu is simple: choose an item (burrito, taco, quesadilla, etc). and then choose a type of meat (chicken, steak, etc). Each item is already loaded with everything you would want: spanish rice, beans, lettuce, sour cream and so on. 

I ordered a steak burrito without beans and thoroughly enjoyed it. They used real steak meat, not the cheap kind, and the burrito itself wasn't greasy like the ones served in real mexican taquerias. Overall, pretty good. I've now added Pasilla to my rotating lunch rounds.
author: Jenny T.

description: Huge burritos, fully loaded (and not with your typical rice and beans filler), awesome salsa bar (they had yummy jicama salad last time I was here), food tasted fresh also and they make it fast. I usually order the vegetarian burrito with wheat tortilla because that is me. No grease on my burrito and the homemade guac was definitely not whack. Go here if you're in the fiddy and want to skip the long lines with the other place that rhymes with Chiptole. I would write a longer review but my mid-afternoon, carb-induced narcolepsy has just kicked in.
author: Christian C.

description:
Always wish I could do half stars because this place is probably more like 3 and a half stars, but I was more happy with the meal than just satisfied.

The place is clean, the people behind the counter were friendly enough, had an open salsa-bar, and good guacamole.  So it passed my initial tests.

As you get the food, it's pretty easy to tell that most of the stuff is store bought, the chips, the tortilla's, the taco-shells, all could be right off the shelf from Safeway.  But as I said, it hit the spot, the Quesadilla was not greasy at all, yet packed with cheese.  The Steak, and this is most important, was delicious.  I was glad not to get some gnarly, chewy, gristly bits like most Mexican restaurants pass off to you, they were nice, delicious chunks of marinated beef.

This place isn't going to win any awards, or compete with the Mission, but it's decent American-style Mexican food at a reasonable price, so it gets a thumbs up from me.
author: Tyler D.

description:
Feels healthier than El Faro, across the street, but only if you get their meat-based burritos and bowls. DO NOT get the vegetarian burrito / bowl. It's just rice, beans and a bit of salsa + lettuce. El Faro's vegetarian option at least has peppers.

Am a fan of their spicy chicken. Plus, they have sliced and whole jalapenos at the salsa bar.
author: Abid M.

description:
Plus: They take credit card and their staff is exceptionally friendly. When they screwed up, the remade my order, and offered to let me keep the old one too.

Cons: Well, they did screw up my order, and the food wasn't so great. I had Fish Tacos. The fish was nonexistant in one taco, and it was really firm. It'd been cooked too long.

The guy was nice though, so they get 3 stars.
author: Cory D.

description: My NEW goto place for a burrito @ lunch.  Hard to beat.
author: Erik J.

description:
Finding a good burrito in the FIDI is impossible.  Finding a good burrito at a place named ".. Grill" is impossible.  Finding a good burrito at a place named after a pepper is... 

Why did I go here then, knowing our lunch mission was doomed to fail?

Pluses
Fresh lettuce
jicama salsa was nice (gained a star on this alone)
Close to work, when it rains

Minuses
stomach dance all  afternoon
Beans not cooked through
Cheese was government grade, shredded
Wasn't even cheap @ $9 for veggie burrito and a drink?
Taking new orders is a higher priority for the counter staff than passing out the food to waiting customers, allows food to get cold.
Bland
Boring
crappy front door step is dangerous, should be ramped instead
May as well be named "Chipotle with Fresh Lettuce"
author: Lost S.

description: Not bad food but the price leaves you asking for more. I like the quinoa option which is ofcourse a tad expensive. A good work lunch to go place.
author: Rashmi V.

description:
I was staying in the Financial District and ended up eating at Pasilla Mexican Grill after searching for something quick and easy at around 8pm.  The store layout is very similar to Chipotle and maybe not surprisingly the food was similar.  The food was good, definitely above average.  Additionally, the store was quite clean and the people that worked there were extremely nice and helpful.  I stopped in right as they were closing, but they had no problem with me eating inside.  They even gave me a cup of guacamole on the house.

Overall, the food was good but the service and attitude of those working there was what really won me over.
author: Kirk S.

description: Quick stop for lunch if you order a burrito, not so much if you order a quesadilla. Not much room to sit, mostly a grab and go place.
author: Gee H.

description:
This is better than Chipotle. I know that is hard for some to believe, but it is true. There is rarely a line like Chipotles are prone to developing, and they put a lot more chicken on the tacos than Chipotle does.

The salsas are excellent, and the chips are good as well. The drink options are standard fare for a restaurant, though I usually opt for the free cups of water rather than buying a drink as well as the three taco combo.
author: Jesse R.

description: The marinated steak tacos are beyond excellent! .....perfectly seasoned...everything I had was fresh, and my 3 taco order was plenty to eat....I will be back!
author: Erik B.

description:
I've said it once, I'll say it again. They make a well-distributed burrito. Don't have to worry about getting a bite of only rice or only beans--well mixed!

Spicy Chicken Burrito is where its at.
author: Evan W.

description:
Ordered the fish tacos on soft corn tortillas. Got back to work with flour tortillas.   The fish was way over-cooked and dry and way over-spiced.  The cabbage in the tacos was delicious.  I would order it as a salad.  The guacamole was fresh and fantastic. The tortilla chips were seemingly store-bought.   The jicama salad was great. The salsas were great.  Might give them one more try, but won't order the fish again.

Service was fast.
author: Sarah F.

description: Vegetarian bowl is SO satisfying.. I get it w/o cheese to cut the calories and you'd never even notice it was gone. It's obviously not gourmet but it's exactly what you want for lunch.
author: Nikki H.

description:
I am ADDICTED to the Pasilla Bowl. I have it at least three times a week. Spicy chicken with no rice and black beans - filling, healthy(ish) and less than $8. They definitely don't skimp on the sour cream and cheese which I appreciate.

I suggest calling in your order - especially during the lunch rush - as the wait can be annoying.

FYI, if you're looking for a down and dirty Mexican food place, this is not it. It's definitely less traditional and greasy than its competitor just across the way.

It's also open long after most places around here close, so that's a definite plus.
author: Marie A.

description:
This place is where 360 Burritos used to be. Thank god -- 360 Burritos is an abomination.

I had the spicy chicken tacos. Three tacos to an order. They were full of grilled white meat chicken, tomato, lettuce, cheese, and salsa. Nice and messy. They tasted fresh, and the salsa bar had jalapenos, onion, cilantro, and three salsas to choose from. The green salsa, while not spicy, has a great flavor.

One very nice thing is that they are not stingy about the salsa, like some other FiDi burrito places. The cashier told me "Load up on salsa!" So I did. 

Another plus is that they accept credit cards, with no "minimum purchase requirement", which is against the Visa/MasterCard merchant agreements and is one of my pet peeves.

I think they are associated with the Working Girls Cafe; they were using Working Girls bags for the chips, and some of the employees were wearing Working Girls shirts. Not a bad thing; Working Girls is a decent sandwich joint.

This place is definitely better than El Faro across the street. No comparison. 

I'll be back, and try the burrito next time.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Outstanding Mexican food with fast service and a friendly staff.

I've been here several times and the food has been consistently great.  The food quality is high and always fresh.

I recommend trying one of their chicken burritos or quesadillas.  The chicken is all white meat with a very tasty marinade.

This food has 10x the flavor of the competitor I won't name who's across the street.

I'll continue visiting Pasilla regularly.
author: Eric T.

description:
I went here to get a burrito on a coworkers recommendation, but I can't say i'd recommend it if a good burrito is what you're looking for.  

I ordered the pork burrito because I usually get carnitas at my often frequented burrito place, and was failry disappointed by the result.  The rice and pinto beans were fine, but the pork was soggy and had very little flavor.  The salsa tasted good, but overall, the blandness of the pork really killed the burrito.  

For just the burrito I would give them 2 stars, but they do have a salsa bar thing on the side with various kinds of salsa, peppers, and other stuff, which is nice since most other places charge you for that kind of stuff. Oh, and the staff is nice as well. Therefore 3 stars.
author: Eric W.

description:
I love the spicy chicken tacos here! 

The price is reasonable and the staff is super friendly. I visit once or twice a week on my lunch hour and the food is consistently yummy. The green salsa may be the best I've ever had.
author: Candace M.

description:
Okay, so I was a little disappointed when I went in asking for a wet burrito and they looked back at me with big blank stares on their faces. I changed my order to a simple fish taco because I felt awkward and didn't want to just walk out with nothing but to my surprise, i surprisingly loved it.
 Great fresh fish and the salsa bar was semi decent. This place was kind of like a less corporate Chipotle, quality Mexican food in a random location. I'd go back and try something else, too bad they're never open when I try to go. Whatever though, if you live in the financial district and can't go more than a few days without some kind of Mexican food like me, then try this place out. I doubt you'll be disappointed :)
author: Erika S.

description: Friendly, fast and fresh ingredients. Great taco salad and spicy chicken anything. They don't skimp on the guac, which is a rarity!
author: jaja w.

description:
Yuppie mexican food. My chicken burrito, while good, tasted too healthy, and was actually of a reasonable size (smaller than my head). The "hot" salsa was not that hot.

Watch your step when entering; the floor is about 6 inches higher than street level, and there is no "WATCH YOUR STEP" sign anywhere.
author: Rob T.

description:
VERY DISAPPOINTING!!! My only reason I came here is because the nearby curry place was closed.  Plus, I've been craving tacos for the last few days.  It looked like a good, clean place and nice looking salsa bar so I walked in.  Not sure how people are comparing it to Chipotle.

I ordered the crispy steak tacos and a bag of chips.  I was so hungry and was ready to tear it up.  I opened up the nicely foiled food and noticed these cold FAKE tacos!  These were the flashback tacos when people are first introduced to tacos that are made from a taco kit in a box.  The shredded cheese never melted and it was still cold.  

Well, what can I do?  I've invested 30 minutes of my lunch hour to get these fake tacos but I have to eat.  First bite was like, WHAT, WHERE'S THE CRUNCH!?  They didn't even have the decency to put the Ol El Paso taco shells in the oven to crisp them up?!  My jaws were hurting by the time I got done with these chewy El Paso's.

Can you get kidney stones from eating chewy, undercooked El Paso taco shells?  Not sure where they buy their tortilla chips but it was hella salty.
author: danny m.

description: Best burritos in the financial district.  Good size and they have a salsa bar there that you can get additional salsa on for your burrito.  Surprised by the number of comments about the bland burritos.  Mine have always been good.
author: Grant S.

description:
Watch your step or you'll fall flat on your face. WHY would a place have their threshold 6 inches above the ground in the busy financial district? That is what I call stupid with a capital S.

Otherwise, their veggie burrito (not vegan!) was very tasty. Their all-you-can-take-with-you salsa is also good. The guac and chips are also good.

Extras, like chips, cost money. Prices are decent for the area. I liked it a little better than El Faro across the street, although El Faro has a much bigger selection. Pasilla is definitely lowest common denominator white Yuppie. When I'm feeling overwhelmed by diversity I'll return.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
Spicy chicken burrito was what i expected. Spicy, meaty and filled with rice, salsa, beans. Not too much of anything. I ate the WHOLE thing. 

I would go back for more.

It does get busy around lunch time so beware of the long lines and crowded space.
author: Oanh N.

description:
Delic! I just ate my spicy chicken burrito and YUMMY IN MY TUMMY! 

This place WHOOPS El Faro's ASS...I mean in a cock fight between El Faro and Pasilla- Pasilla would win- the chicken is leaner, quicker, better looking, and keeps the money in your pocket. 

Menu was easy to read, staff was friendly, food was good, prices were reasonable and service was super fast. 

I really only take away stars because there is no place to stand or sit when this place is busy. Other than this- bet on Pasilla it is a win!
author: Ka C.

description:
Think Chipotle without seating.

I had heard good things about this place. But, as is often the case, reality did not live up to the hype. I tried the crispy fish tacos. Everything inside the tacos was decent. The guacamole was good. The lettuce was a step up from unseasoned iceberg. And the fish didn't taste too old, but not especially fresh either.

What spoiled the taco was the unheated, straight-from-the-box shell. All they have to do is stick those suckers in the oven for a few minutes and they'd have a decent taco. Maybe their employees were too lazy to use the oven today. Maybe they don't have an oven. But if that's the case, they should stick to soft.
author: Richard B.

description: This is a solid good restaurant--fast food, but healty, clean and very good ingrediants...clearly they understand healthy mexican food. They grill their own pasilla pepers--delicious.  I often just get a salad bowl filled with black beans and grilled veggies.. super good and low calorie. Guac is very good.  Good  prices. But no atmosphere really to sit-- this is a take out Mexican Grill.  And yes, El Faro is old school, lard in your beans kind of place, so stay away from their if you care about your arteries.
author: David B.

description:
Fresher and cleaner than your usual taco stop.  Nice salsa bar with 3 flavors + marinated stuff.  Menu is very simple with only 3-4 choice (take a guess: taco, burrito, salad).
I always get the 3 taco's - soft w/ chicken.  Ask to hold the sour cream unless you really like it as they tend to overdue it.
Negative is there is only 2 tables and the door is always left open right next to them so not good if it's busy or cold out.
author: Ric S.

description: A coworker urged me to try this place. Went on a Friday about 2pm. Price reasonable and love the salsa bar, and especially loved that they have minced cilantro for your taking. As I was waiting for the burrito to be made, I noticed the cleanliness of the place. Everything is really clean and orderly. Within minutes, got my burrito and took it back to work.
